instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3547: What is 820-3547? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U8900: What is U8900? This chip creates the GPU power rails on the 820-3332 board to the 2012 and early 2013 15‚Äù Retina Macbook Pros. It becomes desoldered and is the cause of no video and kernel panics/crashes in that model most of the time..
definitions.820-3332: What is 820-3332? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.820-3662: What is 820-3662? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3547</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no gong no video
threads.message:
I have a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3547</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> EMC 2674 15" MacBook Pro 2012 not booting MOST of time.Sometimes machine will gong and boot but rarely. When it does gong reset smc and pram 4 times.
Fans spin no gong no video.
I suspect failing GPU. Is there anything I should check before calling this one not repairable?
I understand that a recall on this machine is expired?
Thanks

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3547</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no gong no video
threads.message: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3547</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> is an IO board....Is this a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>? If so <CHIP>U8900</CHIP>, read the sticky on it.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3547</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no gong no video
threads.message:
15" 1398 etc 2674 i7 2ghz  Sorry <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Late 2013
Searched for <CHIP>U8900</CHIP> couldn't find on board view.
